result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J M Kerber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
-Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: -to any current sentence
Concurrent with: -with count 3.

superMiscConds.notes: -Restitution to be determined at Restitution Hearing.

-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
-To have no contact with any known drug users or sellers.

-No contact with any victims in 22CF82.
-Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 20 days of Extended Supervision. 
-Fulfill all legal obligations arising out of the 1/14/22 incident. 
-Reconnect with AA within first 20 days of Extended Supervision, participate on at least a weekly basis and obtain a sponsor within 45 days of attending meeting. 
-Operate a motor vehicle only with a valid driver's license. 
-No new law violations. 
-If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

1:46 PM Defendant Joshua J M Kerber in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Joshua J M Kerber.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for a renewed plea Count 1 and sentencing on Counts 1 and 3.
State filed an amended information.
Court accepts the amended information.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea as to Count 1.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Plea entered on Count 3 to remain as previously entered on 3/28/22.
Both counsel have received and reviewed the presentence investigation report.
Neither have any changes to make.
Court notes a typo on the presentence investigation report.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.
State requests a restitution hearing in 22CF82.  Defendant may appear by video for the next hearing.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0) CONCURRENT with Count 3 but CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence
-	3 Years of Initial Confinement
-	3 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	No contact with with any victims in 22CF82.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	To have no contact with any known drug users or sellers;
-	Complete a Criminal Thinking Course;
-	Maintain/Obtain full time employment (35 hours per week) within the first 30 days of Extended Supervision;
-	Fulfull all legal obligations arising out of the 1/14/22 incident.
-	Reconnect with AA within first 30 days of Extended Supervision, participate on at least a weekly basis and obtain a sponsor within 45 days of attending meetings;
-	Operate a Motor Vehicle only with a Valid Driver's License;
-	No new law violations;

RESTITUTION:  to be determined at a future hearing

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  


Count 3:
3 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0) CONCURRENT with Count 1 but CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence
-	1 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Same as Count 1

RESTITUTION:  to be determined at a future hearing

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DR GOD Surcharge: $10.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
